1396878_11_ITEM15_P6_S0	Ethics are important to United States Commodity Funds LLC (the Company ) and to each member of our management, our investment professionals, and our employees.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P6_S1	The Company is committed to the highest ethical standards and to conducting business with the highest level of integrity.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P7_S0	All officers, directors and employees of the Company are responsible for maintaining this level of integrity and for complying with the policies contained in this Code.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P7_S1	If you have a question or concern about what is proper conduct for you or anyone else, please raise these concerns with any member of management, or follow the procedures outlined this Code.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P8_S0	reaffirm and promote our commitment to a corporate culture that values honesty and accountability.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P9_S0	All employees, as a condition of employment or continued employment, will acknowledge in writing that they have received a copy of this Code, read it, and understand that the Code contains our expectations regarding their conduct.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P10_S0	Finally, you should know that this Code is designed to satisfy the standards contained in the Federal Sentencing Guidelines for Organizations published by the U.S. Department of Justice.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P10_S1	U.S. federal courts are bound to apply the Federal Sentencing Guidelines for Organizations when sentencing companies convicted of federal offenses arising from the illegal acts of one or more employees.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P10_S2	The Federal Sentencing Guidelines for Organizations provide for substantial leniency in sentencing of a company from otherwise severe mandatory penalties, where the company had in effect an adequate compliance program at the time of the illegal activity.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P11_S0	You must avoid any conflict, or the appearance of a conflict, between your personal interests and our interests.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P11_S1	A conflict exists when your personal interest in any way interferes with our interests, or when you take any action or have any interest that may make it difficult for you to perform your job objectively and effectively.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P11_S2	For example, a conflict of interest probably exists if:
1396878_11_ITEM15_P12_S0	you use or communicate confidential information obtained in the course of your work for your or another s personal benefit.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P13_S0	Each of us has a duty to advance the legitimate interests of the Company when the opportunity to do so presents itself.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P14_S0	compete, or prepare to compete, with us.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P15_S0	We are committed to a policy of full, fair, accurate, timely, and understandable disclosure to unitholders of all material information regarding our business.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P15_S1	This policy extends to our filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission ( SEC ) and to all other public communications.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P15_S2	All individuals involved in our SEC reporting process and in preparing and making public communications regarding our business must take all reasonable steps to comply with this policy.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P16_S0	You must not disclose confidential information regarding the Company, our service providers, the Trust, the Funds, or our affiliates, unless disclosure is authorized or required by law.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P16_S1	Confidential information includes all non-public information that might be harmful to, or useful to the competitors of, the Company, the Trust, any Fund, our affiliates, our service providers, or our other business partners.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P17_S0	You must endeavor to deal fairly with companies or individuals with whom we do business or come into contact, including fellow employees of the Company and our competitors.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P17_S1	You must not take unfair advantage of these or other parties by means of:
1396878_11_ITEM15_P18_S0	Our assets are to be used only for legitimate business purposes.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P18_S1	You should protect our assets and ensure that they are used efficiently.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P19_S0	Incidental personal use of telephones, fax machines, copy machines, personal computers and similar equipment is generally allowed if there is no significant added cost to us, it does not interfere with your work duties, and is not related to an illegal activity or to any outside business.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P20_S0	Each of us has a duty to comply with all laws, rules and regulations that apply to our business.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P20_S1	Highlighted below are some of the key compliance guidelines that must be followed.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P21_S0	It is against the law to buy or sell securities using material information that is not available to the public.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P21_S1	Individuals who give this inside information to others may be liable to the same extent as the individuals who trade while in possession of such information.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P21_S2	You must not trade the units of any Fund, or the securities of our affiliates, our service providers, or any of our other business partners while in the possession of inside information.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P22_S0	It is against the law to discharge, demote, suspend, threaten, harass, or discriminate in any manner against an employee who provides information or otherwise assists in investigations or proceedings relating to violations of federal securities laws or other federal laws prohibiting fraud against unitholders.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P22_S1	You must not discriminate in any way against an employee who engages in these whistleblower activities.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P23_S0	You must adhere to appropriate procedures governing the retention and destruction of records consistent with applicable laws, regulations and our policies.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P23_S1	You may not destroy, alter or falsify any document that may be relevant to a threatened or pending lawsuit or governmental investigation.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P24_S0	Please talk to any member of management if you have any questions about how to comply with the above regulations and other laws, rules and regulations.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P25_S0	We are committed to providing equal opportunity in all of our employment practices including selection, hiring, promotion, transfer, and compensation of all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, sex or gender, religion, age, national origin, handicap, disability, citizenship status, or any other status protected by law.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P25_S1	With this in mind, there are certain behaviors that will not be tolerated.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P25_S2	These include harassment, violence, intimidation, and discrimination of any kind involving race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, or marital status.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P26_S0	We require honest and accurate recording and reporting of information in order to make responsible business decisions.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P26_S1	This includes such data as quality, safety, and personnel records, as well as financial records.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P27_S0	All financial books, records and accounts must accurately reflect transactions and events, and conform both to required accounting principles and to our system of internal controls.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P27_S1	No false or artificial entries may be made.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P28_S0	The law requires us to maintain certain types of corporate records, usually for specified periods of time.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P28_S1	Failure to retain those records for those minimum periods could subject us to penalties and fines, cause the loss of rights, obstruct justice, place us in contempt of court, or seriously disadvantage us in litigation.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P29_S0	From time to time we establish retention or destruction policies in order to ensure legal compliance.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P29_S1	We expect you to fully comply with any published records retention or destruction policies, provided that you should note the following exception: If you believe, or we inform you, that our records are relevant to any litigation or governmental action, or any potential litigation or action, then you must preserve those records until we determine the records are no longer needed.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P29_S2	This exception supersedes any previously or subsequently established destruction policies for those records.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P29_S3	If you believe that this exception may apply, or have any questions regarding the possible applicability of that exception, please contact our Chief Compliance Officer, Howard Mah (the Chief Compliance Officer ).
1396878_11_ITEM15_P30_S0	No funds of the Company, of the Trust or of any Fund may be given directly to political candidates.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P30_S1	You may, however, engage in political activity with your own resources on your own time.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P31_S0	We must speak with a unified voice in all dealings with the press and other media.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P31_S1	As a result, the President and CEO is the sole contact for media seeking information about the Company, the Trust or any of the Funds.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P31_S2	Any requests from the media must be referred to him.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P31_S3	Unless another individual(s) is so authorized by the President and CEO.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P31_S4	In the event the President and CEO and other authorized individual(s) are not available, clearance must be obtained through the Chief Compliance Officer.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P32_S0	Information generated in our business is a valuable asset.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P32_S1	Protecting this information plays an important role in our growth and ability to compete.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P32_S2	Such information includes business and research plans; objectives and strategies; trade secrets; unpublished financial information; salary and benefits data; and business partner lists.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P32_S3	Employees who have access to our intellectual property information are obligated to safeguard it from unauthorized access and must:
1396878_11_ITEM15_P33_S0	Not share this information with other employees except on a legitimate need to know basis.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P34_S0	We may provide an e-mail system and Internet access to certain of our employees to help them do their work.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P34_S1	You may use the e-mail system and the Internet only for legitimate business purposes in the course of your duties.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P34_S2	Incidental and occasional personal use is permitted, but never for personal gain or any improper use.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P34_S3	Further, you are prohibited from discussing or posting information regarding the Company, the Trust or any of the Funds in any external electronic forum, including Internet chat rooms or electronic bulletin boards.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P35_S0	You are responsible for compliance with the rules, standards and principles described in this Code.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P35_S1	In addition, you should be alert to possible violations of the Code by the Company s employees, officers and directors, and you are expected to report a violation promptly.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P35_S2	Normally, reports should be made to one s immediate supervisor.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P35_S3	Under some circumstances, it may be impractical or you may feel uncomfortable raising a matter with your supervisor.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P35_S4	In those instances, you are encouraged to contact our Chief Compliance Officer who will investigate and report the matter to the Board of Directors, as the circumstance dictates.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P35_S5	You will also be expected to cooperate in an investigation of a violation.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P36_S0	Anyone who has a concern about our conduct, the conduct of an officer of the Company or our accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters, may communicate that concern to the Chief Compliance Officer or to the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors by direct communication with our Chairman of the Audit Committee or by e-mail or in writing.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P36_S1	In addition, anyone who has a concern specifically about (i) the Trust or USCI may communicate that concern to the Chief Compliance Officer, or (ii) any of the Funds other than USCI, may communicate that concern to the Chief Compliance Officer or to the Audit Committee.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P36_S2	All reported concerns shall be forwarded to the Chief Compliance Officer or the Audit Committee, as applicable, in the same way that other concerns are addressed by us.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P36_S3	The status of all outstanding concerns forwarded to the Audit Committee or the Chief Compliance Officer will be reported on a quarterly basis by our Chairman of the Audit Committee or Chief Compliance Officer, as applicable.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P36_S4	The Audit Committee or Chief Compliance Officer, as applicable, may direct that certain matters be presented to the full Board of Directors and may also direct special treatment, including the retention of outside advisors or counsel, for any concern reported to it.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P37_S0	All reports will be investigated and whenever possible, requests for confidentiality shall be honored.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P37_S1	And, while anonymous reports will be accepted, please understand that anonymity may hinder or impede the investigation of a report.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P37_S2	All cases of questionable activity or improper actions will be reviewed for appropriate action, discipline or corrective actions.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P37_S3	Whenever possible, we will keep confidential the identity of employees, officers or directors who are accused of violations, unless or until it has been determined that a violation has occurred.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P38_S0	There will be no reprisal, retaliation or adverse action taken against any employee who, in good faith, reports or assists in the investigation of, a violation or suspected violation, or who makes an inquiry about the appropriateness of an anticipated or actual course of action.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P39_S0	For reporting concerns about the conduct of the Company, the Trust or any Fund, the conduct of an officer of the Company, or about accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters of the Company, the Trust or any Fund, you may use the following means of communication:
1396878_11_ITEM15_P40_S0	If to the Chief Compliance Officer:
1396878_11_ITEM15_P41_S0	If to the Chairman of the Audit Committee:
1396878_11_ITEM15_P42_S0	All violations of the Code will result in appropriate corrective action, up to and including dismissal.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P42_S1	If the violation involves potentially criminal activity, the individual or individuals in question will be reported, as warranted, to the appropriate authorities.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P43_S0	All of the officers, directors, and employees are subject to this Code.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P43_S1	Any waiver of this Code for an executive officer or director of the Company may only be made by the Board of Directors or the Audit Committee.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P43_S2	Any waiver of the Code for an officer or member of our Boards of Directors must be promptly disclosed to unitholders.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P44_S0	This acknowledgment is to be signed and returned to our Chief Compliance Officer, Howard Mah, and will be retained as part of your permanent personnel file.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P45_S0	LLC s Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, read it, and understand that the Code contains the expectations of United States Commodity Funds LLC regarding employee conduct.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P45_S1	I also understand that the Code is issued for informational purposes and that it is not intended to create, nor does it represent, a contract of employment.

1396878_11_ITEM15_P47_S0	We hereby consent to the incorporation by reference in the Registration Statement Number 333-162717 on Form S-3 of our report dated March 14, 2011 relating to the financial statements of United States Gasoline Fund, LP as of December 31, 2010 and 2009 and for the years ended December 31, 2010, 2009 and 2008 and the effectiveness of United States Gasoline Fund, LP s internal control over financial reporting dated March 14, 2011, appearing in this Annual Report on Form 10-K of United States Gasoline Fund, LP for the year ended December 31, 2010.

1396878_11_ITEM15_P54_S0	(b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant s internal control over financial reporting.
1396878_11_ITEM15_P55_S0	In connection with the Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2010 (the Report ) of United States Gasoline Fund, LP (the Registrant ), as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof, I, Nicholas D.
