1396878_12_ITEM14_P30_S0	ARTICLE III MEMBER Section 3.1 Membership Interest.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P30_S1	The Member is admitted as a member of the Company upon the execution and delivery of this Agreement, and is the only member of the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P30_S2	The Member has a one hundred percent (100%) interest in the Company and in the profits and losses thereof.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P30_S3	The Member made an initial contribution to the capital of the Company, in cash, the amount of $1,000.00 at time the Company was formed.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P30_S4	The Member is not obligated to make any additional capital contributions to the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P30_S5	No certificates shall be issued evidencing the membership interest in the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P31_S0	Section 3.4 Rights of the Member.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P31_S1	The Member, in its capacity as such, shall take no pat in the management or control of the Company s business and shall have no right to act for or bind the Company or to vote on matters other than the matters specified in this Agreement or required by any non-waivable provision of the Act.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P32_S0	ARTICLE IV DIRECTORS Section 4.1 Number and Qualification.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P32_S1	Thee shall be seven Directors, four of which shall be Management Directors and thee of which shall be Non-Management Directors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P33_S0	The Management Directors may change the number of Management Directors and Non-Management Directors from time to time by written consent of the Management Directors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P33_S1	Directors need not be residents of the State of Delaware.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P33_S2	The Member shall elect the Management Directors and the Non-Management Directors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P33_S3	Section 4.2 Election and Term of Office.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P33_S4	The Directors shall be elected by written consent of the Member (except as provided in Section 4.8).
1396878_12_ITEM14_P33_S5	Each Director elected shall hold office until his successor shall be chosen by written consent of the Member and shall qualify, or until his death or his resignation or removal in the manner hereinafter provided.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P33_S6	Any Director may resign at any time by giving written notice to the President or Secretary of the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P33_S7	Such resignation shall take effect at die time specified therein, and unless otherwise specified therein, the acceptance of such resignation shall not be necessary to make it effective.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P34_S0	By written consent of the Member, any Director or Directors, including all of the Directors, may be removed, either with or without cause.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P34_S1	Any vacancy occurring in the Directors (including a vacancy resulting from an increase in the authorized number of Directors) may be filled by the written consent of the Member.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P34_S2	A Director elected to ill a vacancy shall be elected for the unexpired term of his predecessor in office.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P35_S0	The powers of the Company shall be exercised by or under the authority of, and the business and affairs of the Company shall be managed under the direction of, the Management Directors, subject to the terms of this Agreement.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P35_S1	The Non-Management Directors shall only have such authority as the Management Directors expressly confer upon them.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P36_S0	Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this Section 4.6, each of Nicholas D. Gerber and Howard Mah, so long as he shall remain a Manager and in his capacity as such, shall have the right to act for and bind the Company, but no other individual Manager, in his capacity as such, shall have the right to act for or bind the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P36_S1	Management Directors as such shall not receive any stated salary for their service, but expenses of attendance, if any, may be allowed for attendance at any regular or special meeting of the Directors or a committee thereof, provided that nothing herein contained shall be construed to preclude any Management Director from serving the Company in any other capacity and receiving compensation therefore.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P36_S2	Non-Management Directors may receive compensation for their services together with expenses of attendance, if any, for attendance at any regular or special meeting of the Directors or a committee thereof, as such compensation and expenses may be determined from time to time by the Management Directors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P37_S0	ARTICLE V MEETINGS OF DIRECTORS Section 5.1 Place of Meeting.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P38_S0	The Directors of the Company may hold their meetings, both regular and special, either within or without the State of Delaware.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P38_S1	An annual meeting of the Directors shall be held at such time and place as shall be fixed by the consent in writing of a majority of the Directors, and no notice to the newly elected Directors of such meeting shall be necessary in order legally to constitute the meeting, provided a quorum shall be present.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P38_S2	Section 5.3 Regular Meetings Regular meetings of the Directors, in addition to the annual meetings referred to in Section 5.2, may be held without notice at such time and place as shall from time to time be determined by the Directors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P38_S3	Special meetings of the Directors may be called by the Chairman, if one shall be elected, the Vice Chairman, if one shall be elected, or by the President, on one (1) day s notice (oral or written) to each Director, Special meetings shall be called by the President or the Secretary on like notice on the written request of any Director.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P38_S4	Neither the purpose of, nor the business to be transacted at, any special meeting of the Directors need be specified in the notice or waiver of notice of such meeting.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P39_S0	At all meetings of the Directors, the presence of a majority of the number of Management Directors fixed by or in accordance with this Agreement shall be necessary and sufficient to constitute a quorum for the transaction of business.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P39_S1	Subject to the preceding sentence, the act of a majority of the Management Directors at any meeting at which a quorum is present shall be the act of the Directors unless the act of a greater number is required by law, the Certificate or this Agreement.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P39_S2	If a quorum shall not be present at any meeting of the Directors, the Directors present may adjourn the meeting from time to time without notice other than announcement at the meeting until a quorum shall be present.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P40_S0	Section 5.6 Presumption of Assent to Action.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P40_S1	A Director who is present at a meeting of the Directors at which action on any matter is taken shall be presumed to have assented to the action taken unless his dissent shall be entered in the minutes of the meeting or unless he shall file his written dissent to such action with the secretary of the meeting before the adjournment thereof or shall forward such dissent by registered mail to the Secretary of the Company immediately after the adjournment of the meeting.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P40_S2	Such right to dissent shall not apply to a Director who votes in favor of such action.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P41_S0	Directors may participate in and hold a meeting of the Directors by means of conference telephone or similar communications equipment by means of which all Directors participating in the meeting can hear each other.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P41_S1	Participation in a meeting pursuant to this Section shall constitute presence in person at such meeting, except where a Director participates in the meeting for the express purpose of objecting to the transaction of any business on the ground that the meeting is not lawfully called or convened.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P42_S0	Section 5.8 Action Without Meeting Any action required or permitted to be taken at a meeting of the Directors may be taken without a meeting if a consent in writing, setting forth the action so taken, is signed by all the Management Directors, or members of the committee, as the case may be, and such consent shall have the same force and effect as a unanimous vote at a meeting.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P43_S0	Attendance of a Director at a meeting shall constitute a waiver of notice of such meeting except where a Director attends a meeting for the express purpose of objecting to the transaction of any business on the grounds that the meeting is not lawfully called or convened.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P44_S0	ARTICLE VI COMMITTEES OF THE DIRECTORS Section 6.1 Company and Authorities.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P44_S1	Subject to Section 6.2, the Management Directors, by written consent, may designate from among the Directors one or more committees, each of which shall be comprised of one or more Directors, and may designate one or more Directors as alternate members of any committee, who may, subject to any limitations imposed by the Management Directors, replace absent or disqualified Directors at any meeting of that committee.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P44_S2	Any such committee, to the extent provided in such resolution, shall have and may exercise all of the authority of the Directors in the business and affairs of the Company, subject to the limitations set forth in the Act or this Agreement and Section 6.2.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P44_S3	The members of each such committee shall serve at the pleasure of the Management Directors, subject to the limitations set forth in Section 6.2.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P45_S0	The audit committee shall consist of all of the Non-Management Directors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P45_S1	(b) Notwithstanding anything in this Agreement to the contrary, the Management Directors shall establish and maintain an audit committee in compliance with, and granted the requisite authority and funding pursuant to, any applicable (1) federal securities laws and regulations, including the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, and (2) rules, policies and procedures of any national securities exchange on which the securities issued by any of United States Oil Fund, LP, United States Natural Gas Fund, LP, United States 12 Month Oil Fund, LP, United States Gasoline Fund, LP, United States Heating Oil Fund, LP, United States 12 Month Natural Gas Fund, LP, United States Brent Oil Fund, LP, United States Shot Oil Fund, LP, all series funds organized under the United States Commodity Index Funds Trust, all series funds organized under the United States Commodity Funds Trust I, all series funds organized under the United States Commodity Funds Trust II or any other fund for which the Company acts as general partner or sponsor, where such securities are registered with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission and/or are listed and traded on any U.S. or foreign exchange.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P46_S0	Section 6.3 Minutes and Rules of Procedure.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P46_S1	Each committee designated by the Management Directors shall keep regular minutes of its proceedings and report the same to the Management Directors when required.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P46_S2	Subject to the provisions of this Agreement, the members of any committee may fix such committee s own rules of procedure.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P46_S3	The Management Directors shall have the power at any time to fill vacancies in, to change the membership of, or to dissolve, any committee, provided that with respect to the audit committee, the Management Directors shall only have the power to ill vacancies and change the membership of such committee to the extent permitted by Section 6.2.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P47_S0	Members of any committee designated by the Management Directors may participate in or hold a meeting by use of conference telephone or similar communications equipment by means of which all committee members participating in the meeting can hear each other.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P47_S1	Participation in a meeting pursuant to this Section shall constitute presence in person at such meeting, except where a committee member participates in the meeting for the express purpose of objecting to the transaction of any business on the grounds that the meeting is not lawfully called or convened.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P48_S0	Any action required or permitted to be taken at a meeting of any committee designated by the Management Directors may be taken without a meeting if a consent in writing, setting forth the action so taken, is signed by all the members of the committee, and such consent shall have the same force and effect as a unanimous vote at a meeting.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P49_S0	Section 6.7 Resolution of Conflicts .
1396878_12_ITEM14_P49_S1	Should any conflicts arise among the Management Directors regarding the operations of Fund, the audit committee, consisting of the Non-Management Directors will resolve the conflict.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P50_S0	ARTICLE VII OFFICERS Section 7.1 Positions and Powers.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P51_S0	(a) The Management Directors may, by written consent, appoint a President, one or more Vice Presidents, a Secretary, a Treasurer, one or more Assistant Secretaries, one or more Assistant Treasurers and other officers.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P51_S1	One individual may hold any two or more of these offices.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P51_S2	(b) Every officer is an agent of the Company for the purpose of its business.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P51_S3	The act of an officer, including the execution in the name of the Company of any instrument for apparently carrying on in the usual way the business of the Company, binds the Company unless the officer so acting otherwise lacks authority to act for the Company and the Person with whom the officer is dealing has knowledge of the fact that the officer has no such authority.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P51_S4	Any officer duly appointed by the Management Directors shall hold office until his successor shall have been duly appointed and qualified or until his death or his resignation or removal in the manner hereinafter provided.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P51_S5	Any officer may resign at any time by giving written notice thereof to the Management Directors or to the President or Secretary of the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P51_S6	Any such resignation shall take effect at the time specified therein and, unless otherwise specified therein, the acceptance of such resignation shall not be necessary to make it effective.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P51_S7	Any officer may be removed at any time with or without cause by written consent of the Management Directors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P51_S8	The removal of any officer shall be without prejudice to the contract rights, if any, of the individual so removed.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P51_S9	Appointment of an officer or agent shall not of itself create any contract rights.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P51_S10	A vacancy in any office may be filled for the unexpired portion of the term by the Management Directors by written consent.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S0	The President shall be the chief executive officer of the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S1	He shall have general and active management of the business of the Company, shall have the general supervision and direction of all other officers of the Company with full power to see that their duties are properly performed and shall see that all orders and resolutions of the Management Directors are carried into effect.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S2	Without limiting the authority of the Management Directors to sign deeds, bonds, mortgages, contracts and other documents on behalf of the Company, the President may sign, with any other proper officer, any deeds, bonds, mortgages, contracts and other documents which the Management Directors have authorized to be executed, except where required by law to be otherwise signed and executed and except where the signing and execution thereof shall be expressly delegated by the Management Directors or this Agreement to some other officer or agent of the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S3	In addition, the President shall perform whatever duties and shall exercise all the powers that are given to him by the Management Directors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S4	The Vice Presidents shall perform the duties as are given to them by this Agreement and as may from time to time be assigned to them by the Management Directors or by the President.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S5	At the request of the President, or in his absence or disability, the Vice President designated by the President (or in the absence of such designation, the senior Vice President), shall perform the duties and exercise the powers of the President.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S6	The Secretary shall be custodian of the limited liability company records and shall perform such other duties as may be prescribed by the Management Directors or by the President, under whose supervision he shall be.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S7	He shall keep in safe custody the seal of the Company and, when authorized by the Management Directors, affix the same to any instrument requiring it, and when so affixed, it may be attested by his signature or by the signature of the Treasurer or an Assistant Secretary.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S8	The Assistant Secretaries shall perform the duties as are given to them by this Agreement or as may from time to time be assigned to them by the Management Directors or by the Secretary.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S9	At the request of the Secretary, or in his absence or disability, the Assistant Secretary designated by the Secretary (or in the absence of such designation the senior Assistant Secretary), shall perform the duties and exercise the powers of the Secretary.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S10	The Treasurer shall have custody of and be responsible for all funds and securities of the Company, shall keep full and accurate accounts of receipts and disbursements in books belonging to the Company and shall deposit all monies and other valuable effects in the name and to the credit of the Company in such depositories as may be designated by the Management Directors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S11	He shall disburse the funds of the Company as may be ordered by the Management Directors, taking proper vouchers for such disbursements, and shall ender to the President and the Management Directors, whenever they may require it, an account of all his transactions as Treasurer and of the financial condition of the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S12	The Assistant Treasurers shall perform the duties as are given to them by this Agreement or as may from time to time be assigned to them by the Management Directors or by the Treasurer.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P52_S13	At the request of the Treasurer, or in his absence or disability, the Assistant Treasurer, designated by the Treasurer (or in the absence of such designation, the senior Assistant Treasurer), shall perform the duties and exercise the powers of the Treasurer.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P53_S0	If required by the Management Directors, the Treasurer and any Assistant Treasurer shall give the Company a bond in such sum and with such surety or sureties as shall be satisfactory to the Management Directors for the faithful performance of the duties of his office and for the restoration to the Company, in case of his death, resignation, retirement or removal from office, of all books, papers, vouchers, money and other property of whatever kind in his possession or under his control belonging to the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P53_S1	The Management Directors may appoint by written consent such other officers and agents as the Management Directors shall deem necessary who shall hold their offices for such terms, have such authority and perform such duties as the Management Directors may from time to time determine.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P53_S2	The salary or other compensation of officers may be fixed from time to time by the Management Directors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P54_S0	ARTICLE VIII CAPITAL ACCOUNT Section 8.1 Capital Account.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P54_S1	A capital account shall be maintained for the Member in accordance with 704 (b) of the Code and the Regulations thereunder.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P55_S0	ARTICLE IX DISTRIBUTIONS Section 9.1 Distributions During Term of Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P55_S1	The Management Directors in their sole discretion prior to dissolution of the Company may, but shall not be obligated to, distribute such Property of the Company, whether in cash or in kind, as the Management Directors may from time to time deem advisable, after the Management Directors have established such reserves as the Management Directors consider appropriate.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P55_S2	On the winding up of the Company pursuant to Section 11.2 hereof, all assets of the Company shall be distributed in accordance with Section 11.3.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P55_S3	Notwithstanding anything in this Agreement to the contrary, no distribution shall be made if it would not be permitted by the Act.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P56_S0	ARTICLE X INDEMNIFICATION Section 10.1 Definitions.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P56_S1	In this Article: (a) Indemnitee means (i) any present or former director or officer of the Company, and (ii) any person who while serving in any of the capacities referred to in clause (i) of this sentence served at the Company s request as a director or officer of any other entity.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P57_S0	(b) Official Capacity means the elective or appointive office of the Company held by such Person or the employment or agency relationship undertaken by such Person on behalf of the Company, but in each case does not include service for any other foreign or domestic limited liability company, corporation or any partnership, joint venture, sole proprietorship, trust, employee benefit plan or other enterprise.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P57_S1	(c) Proceeding means any threatened, pending or completed action, suit or proceeding, whether civil, criminal, administrative, arbitrative or investigative, any appeal in such an action, suit or proceeding, and any inquiry or investigation that could lead to such an action, suit or proceeding.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P58_S0	The Company shall indemnify every Indemnitee against all judgments, penalties (including excise and similar taxes), fines, amounts paid in settlement and reasonable expenses actually incurred by the Indemnitee in connection with any Proceeding in which he was, or is threatened to be, named as a defendant or respondent, or in which he was or is a witness without being named as a defendant or respondent, by reason, in whole or in part, of his serving or having served, or having been nominated or designated to serve, in any of the capacities referred to in Section 10.1, if it is determined in accordance with Section 10.4 that the Indemnitee (a) conducted himself in good faith, (b) reasonably believed, in the case of conduct in his Official Capacity, that his conduct was in the Company s best interests and, in all other cases, that his conduct was at least not opposed to the Company s best interests, and (c) in the case of any criminal proceeding, had no reasonable cause to believe that his conduct was unlawful; provided, however, that in the event that an Indemnitee is found liable to the Company or is found liable on the basis that personal benefit was improperly received by the Indemnitee, the indemnification (i) is limited to reasonable expenses actually incurred by the Indemnitee in connection with the Proceeding and (ii) shall not be made in respect of any Proceeding in which the Indemnitee shall have been found liable for willful or intentional misconduct in the performance of his duty to the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P58_S1	Except as provided in the proviso to the first sentence of this Section 10.2, no indemnification shall be made under this Section 10.2 in respect of any Proceeding in which such Indemnitee shall have been (x) found liable on the basis that personal benefit was improperly received by him, whether or not the benefit resulted from an action taken in the Indemnitee s Official Capacity, or (y) found liable to the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P58_S2	The termination of any Proceeding by judgment, order, settlement or conviction, or on a plea of nolo contendere or its equivalent, is not of itself determinative that the Indemnitee did not meet the requirements set forth in clauses (a), (b) or (c) in the first sentence of this Section 10.2.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P59_S0	An Indemnitee shall be deemed to have been found liable in respect of any claim, issue or matter only after the Indemnitee shall have been so adjudged by a court of competent jurisdiction after exhaustion of all appeals therefrom.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P59_S1	Reasonable expenses shall include, but not be limited to, all court costs and all fees and disbursements of attorneys for the Indemnitee.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P60_S0	The indemnification provided herein shall be applicable whether or not negligence or gross negligence of the Indemnitee is alleged or proven.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P60_S1	Without limiting the generality of Section 10.2 and in addition to the indemnification provided for in Section 10.2, the Company shall indemnify every Indemnitee against reasonable expenses incurred by such Indemnitee in connection with any Proceeding in which he is a witness or a named defendant or respondent because he served in any of the capacities referred to in Section 10.1, if such Indemnitee has been wholly successful, on the merits or otherwise, in defense of the Proceeding.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P61_S0	Any indemnification under Section 10.2 (unless ordered by a court of competent jurisdiction) shall be made by the Company only upon a determination that indemnification of the Indemnitee is proper in the circumstances because he has met the applicable standard of conduct.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P61_S1	Such determination shall be made by written consent of the Management Directors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P61_S2	Determination as to reasonableness of expenses shall be made in the same manner as the determination that indemnification is permissible.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P61_S3	In the event a determination is made under this Section that the Indemnitee has met the applicable standard of conduct as to some matters but not as to others, amounts to be indemnified may be reasonably prorated.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P61_S4	Reasonable expenses (including court costs and attorneys fees) incurred by an Indemnitee who was or is threatened to be made a named defendant or respondent in a Proceeding shall be paid by the Company at reasonable intervals in advance of the final disposition of such Proceeding, and without making any of the determinations specified in Section 10.4, after receipt by the Company of (a) a written affirmation by such Indemnitee of his good faith belief that he has met the standard of conduct necessary for indemnification by the Company under this Article and (b) a written undertaking by or on behalf of such Indemnitee to repay the amount paid or reimbursed by the Company if it shall ultimately be determined that he is not entitled to be indemnified by the Company as authorized in this Article.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P61_S5	Such written undertaking shall be an unlimited obligation of the Indemnitee but need not be secured, and it may be accepted without reference to financial ability to make repayment.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P62_S0	Notwithstanding any other provision of this Article, the Company may pay or reimburse expenses incurred by an Indemnitee in connection with his appearance as a witness or other participation in a Proceeding at a time when he has not been named as a defendant or respondent in the Proceeding.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P62_S1	Section 10.6 Other Indemnification and Insurance.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P62_S2	The indemnification provided by this Article shall (a) not be deemed exclusive of, or to preclude, any other right to which those seeking indemnification may at any time be entitled under the Certificate, any law, agreement or written consent of the Management Directors, or otherwise, or under any policy or policies of insurance purchased and maintained by the Company on behalf of any Indemnitee, both as to action in an Official Capacity and as to action in any other capacity, (b) continue as to a Person who has ceased to be in the capacity by reason of which he was an Indemnitee with respect to matters arising during the period he was in such capacity, (c) inure to the benefit of the heirs, executors and administrators of such a Person, and (d) not be required if and to the extent that the Person otherwise entitled to payment of such amounts hereunder has actually received payment herefore under any insurance policy, contract or otherwise.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P62_S3	The indemnification provided by this Article shall be subject to all valid and applicable laws, and in the event this Article or any of the provisions hereof or the indemnification contemplated hereby are found to be inconsistent with or contrary to any such valid laws, the latter shall be deemed to control and this Article shall be regarded as modified accordingly and, as so modified, to continue in full force and effect.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P63_S0	The provisions of this Article (a) are for the benefit of, and may be enforced by, each Indemnitee of the Company, as if set forth in their entirety in a written instrument duly executed and delivered by the Company and such Indemnitee and (b) constitute a continuing offer to all present and future Indemnitees.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P63_S1	No amendment, modification or repeal of this Article or any provision hereof shall in any manner terminate, reduce or impair the right of any past, present or future Indemnitees to be indemnified by the Company, nor the obligation of the Company to indemnify any such Indemnitees, under and in accordance with the provisions of the Article as in effect immediately prior to such amendment, modification or repeal with respect to claims arising from or relating to matters occurring, in whole or in part, prior to such amendment, modification or repeal, regardless of when such claims may arise or be asserted.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P64_S0	ARTICLE XI DISSOLUTION AND FINAL LIQUIDATION Section 11.1 Dissolution.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P65_S0	On the dissolution of the Company, the Company s affairs shall be wound up as soon as reasonably practicable.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P65_S1	The winding up shall be accomplished by the Management Directors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P66_S0	On the winding up of the Company, its assets shall be applied in the manner, and in the order of priority, provided for in the Act.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P67_S0	Section 11.4 Revocation of Voluntary Dissolution Proceedings.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P67_S1	At any time before the filing of a certificate of cancellation with the Secretary of State, the Company may revoke voluntary dissolution proceedings by the written consent of the Member.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P68_S0	ARTICLE XII AMENDMENT Section 12.1 Amendment of Agreement.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P68_S1	This Agreement may not be amended, supplemented or repealed except by the Member in writing.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P69_S0	ARTICLE XIII GENERAL PROVISIONS Section 13.1 Liability to Third Parties.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P70_S0	Except as otherwise expressly provided by the Act, the debts, obligations and liabilities of the Company, whether arising in contract, tort or otherwise, shall be the debts, obligations and liabilities solely of the Company, and neither the Member or any Director shall be obligated personally for any such debt, obligation or liability of the Company by reason of being the Member or a Director of the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P71_S0	Whenever, under applicable law, the Certificate or this Agreement, any notice is required to be given to the Member or any Director, a waiver thereof in writing signed by the Person or Persons entitled to such notice, whether before or after the time stated therein, shall be equivalent to the giving of such notice.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P72_S0	If one be adopted, the Company seal shall have inscribed thereon the name of the Company and shall be in such form as may be approved by the Management Directors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P72_S1	Such seal may be used by causing it or a facsimile of it to be impressed or affixed or in any manner reproduced.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P73_S0	The fiscal year of the Company shall be the calendar year, or as the Member may designate by resolution, subject to the provisions of Code 706.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P73_S1	All checks or demands for money and notes of the Company shall be signed by such officer or officers or such other Person or Persons as the Management Directors may from time to time designate by written consent.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P74_S0	The Management Directors may authorize by written consent any officer or officers or such other Person or Persons to enter into any contract or execute and deliver any instrument in the name of and on behalf of the Company, and such authority may be general or combined to specific instances.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P75_S0	Section 13.6 Voting Upon Securities by the Company.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P75_S1	Unless otherwise ordered by the Management Directors, the President, acting on behalf of the Company, shall have full power and authority to attend and to act and to vote at any meeting of security holders of any corporation, partnership, limited liability company or other entity in which the Company may hold interests and, at any such meeting, shall posses and may exercise any and all of the rights and powers incident to the ownership of such interests which, as the owner thereof, the Company might have possessed and exercised, if present.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P75_S2	The Management Directors by written consent from time to time may confer like powers upon any other individual or individuals.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P76_S0	All article or section titles or captions in this Agreement are for convenience only.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P76_S1	They shall not be deemed pat of this Agreement and in no way define, limit, extend or describe the scope or intent of any provisions hereof.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P76_S2	Whenever the context may require, any pronoun used in this Agreement shall include the corresponding masculine, feminine or neuter forms, and the singular form of nouns, pronouns and verbs shall include the plural and vice versa.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P77_S0	Section 13.9 Subject to All Laws.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P77_S1	The provisions of this Agreement shall be subject to all valid and applicable laws, including but not limited to the Act as now or hereafter amended, and in the event that any of the provisions of this Agreement are found to be inconsistent with or contrary to any such valid laws, the latter shall be deemed to control and this Agreement shall be deemed modified accordingly and, as so modified, to continue in full force and effect.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P78_S0	Section 13.10 Allocation of Profits and Losses; Tax Status.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P78_S1	The Company s profits and losses shall be allocated to the Member.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P78_S2	At all times that the Company has only one member (who owns 100% of the membership interests in the Company), it is the intention of the Member that the Company be disregarded for federal income tax purposes.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P78_S3	No Person shall take any action that would be inconsistent with such treatment.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P79_S0	IN WITNESS WHEREOF , the Member has executed this Agreement as of the day and year first above written.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P80_S0	CODE OF BUSINESS CONDUCT AND ETHICS Introduction Ethics are important to United States Commodity Funds LLC (the Company ) and to each member of our management, our investment professionals, and our employees.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P80_S1	The Company is committed to the highest ethical standards and to conducting business with the highest level of integrity.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P80_S2	All officers, directors and employees of the Company are responsible for maintaining this level of integrity and for complying with the policies contained in this Code.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P80_S3	If you have a question or concern about what is proper conduct for you or anyone else, please raise these concerns with any member of management, or follow the procedures outlined this Code.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P80_S4	Purpose of the Code This Code is intended to:
1396878_12_ITEM14_P81_S0	reaffirm and promote our commitment to a corporate culture that values honesty and accountability.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P81_S1	All employees, as a condition of employment or continued employment, will acknowledge in writing that they have received a copy of this Code, read it, and understand that the Code contains our expectations regarding their conduct.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P81_S2	Finally, you should know that this Code is designed to satisfy the standards contained in the Federal Sentencing Guidelines for Organizations published by the U.S. Department of Justice.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P81_S3	U.S. federal courts are bound to apply the Federal Sentencing Guidelines for Organizations when sentencing companies convicted of federal offenses arising from the illegal acts of one or more employees.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P81_S4	The Federal Sentencing Guidelines for Organizations provide for substantial leniency in sentencing of a company from otherwise severe mandatory penalties, where the company had in effect an adequate compliance program at the time of the illegal activity.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P82_S0	Conflicts of Interest You must avoid any conflict, or the appearance of a conflict, between your personal interests and our interests.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P82_S1	A conflict exists when your personal interest in any way interferes with our interests, or when you take any action or have any interest that may make it difficult for you to perform your job objectively and effectively.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P82_S2	For example, a conflict of interest probably exists if:
1396878_12_ITEM14_P83_S0	you use or communicate confidential information obtained in the course of your work for your or another s personal benefit.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P84_S0	Corporate Opportunities Each of us has a duty to advance the legitimate interests of the Company when the opportunity to do so presents itself.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P85_S0	compete, or prepare to compete, with us.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P85_S1	We are committed to a policy of full, fair, accurate, timely, and understandable disclosure to unitholders of all material information regarding our business.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P85_S2	This policy extends to our filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission ( SEC ) and to all other public communications.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P85_S3	All individuals involved in our SEC reporting process and in preparing and making public communications regarding our business must take all reasonable steps to comply with this policy.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P86_S0	Confidentiality You must not disclose confidential information regarding the Company, our service providers, the Trust, the Funds, or our affiliates, unless disclosure is authorized or required by law.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P86_S1	Confidential information includes all non-public information that might be harmful to, or useful to the competitors of, the Company, the Trust, any Fund, our affiliates, our service providers, or our other business partners.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P87_S0	Fair Dealing You must endeavor to deal fairly with companies or individuals with whom we do business or come into contact, including fellow employees of the Company and our competitors.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P87_S1	You must not take unfair advantage of these or other parties by means of:
1396878_12_ITEM14_P88_S0	Protection and Proper Use of Company Assets Our assets are to be used only for legitimate business purposes.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P88_S1	You should protect our assets and ensure that they are used efficiently.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P88_S2	Incidental personal use of telephones, fax machines, copy machines, personal computers and similar equipment is generally allowed if there is no significant added cost to us, it does not interfere with your work duties, and is not related to an illegal activity or to any outside business.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P89_S0	Compliance with Applicable Laws, Rules and Regulations Each of us has a duty to comply with all laws, rules and regulations that apply to our business.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P89_S1	Highlighted below are some of the key compliance guidelines that must be followed.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P90_S0	It is against the law to buy or sell securities using material information that is not available to the public.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P90_S1	Individuals who give this inside information to others may be liable to the same extent as the individuals who trade while in possession of such information.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P90_S2	You must not trade the units of any Fund, or the securities of our affiliates, our service providers, or any of our other business partners while in the possession of inside information.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P91_S0	It is against the law to discharge, demote, suspend, threaten, harass, or discriminate in any manner against an employee who provides information or otherwise assists in investigations or proceedings relating to violations of federal securities laws or other federal laws prohibiting fraud against unitholders.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P91_S1	You must not discriminate in any way against an employee who engages in these whistleblower activities.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P92_S0	You must adhere to appropriate procedures governing the retention and destruction of records consistent with applicable laws, regulations and our policies.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P92_S1	You may not destroy, alter or falsify any document that may be relevant to a threatened or pending lawsuit or governmental investigation.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P92_S2	Please talk to any member of management if you have any questions about how to comply with the above regulations and other laws, rules and regulations.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P93_S0	Equal Opportunity, Harassment We are committed to providing equal opportunity in all of our employment practices including selection, hiring, promotion, transfer, and compensation of all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, sex or gender, religion, age, national origin, handicap, disability, citizenship status, or any other status protected by law.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P93_S1	With this in mind, there are certain behaviors that will not be tolerated.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P93_S2	These include harassment, violence, intimidation, and discrimination of any kind involving race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, or marital status.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P94_S0	We require honest and accurate recording and reporting of information in order to make responsible business decisions.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P94_S1	This includes such data as quality, safety, and personnel records, as well as financial records.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P94_S2	All financial books, records and accounts must accurately reflect transactions and events, and conform both to required accounting principles and to our system of internal controls.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P94_S3	No false or artificial entries may be made.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P95_S0	The law requires us to maintain certain types of corporate records, usually for specified periods of time.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P95_S1	Failure to retain those records for those minimum periods could subject us to penalties and fines, cause the loss of rights, obstruct justice, place us in contempt of court, or seriously disadvantage us in litigation.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P96_S0	From time to time we establish retention or destruction policies in order to ensure legal compliance.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P96_S1	We expect you to fully comply with any published records retention or destruction policies, provided that you should note the following exception: If you believe, or we inform you, that our records are relevant to any litigation or governmental action, or any potential litigation or action, then you must preserve those records until we determine the records are no longer needed.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P96_S2	This exception supersedes any previously or subsequently established destruction policies for those records.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P96_S3	If you believe that this exception may apply, or have any questions regarding the possible applicability of that exception, please contact our Chief Compliance Officer, Howard Mah (the Chief Compliance Officer ).
1396878_12_ITEM14_P97_S0	No funds of the Company, of the Trust or of any Fund may be given directly to political candidates.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P97_S1	You may, however, engage in political activity with your own resources on your own time.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P97_S2	We must speak with a unified voice in all dealings with the press and other media.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P97_S3	As a result, the President and CEO is the sole contact for media seeking information about the Company, the Trust or any of the Funds.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P97_S4	Any requests from the media must be referred to him.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P97_S5	Unless another individual(s) is so authorized by the President and CEO.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P97_S6	In the event the President and CEO and other authorized individual(s) are not available, clearance must be obtained through the Chief Compliance Officer.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P98_S0	Promotional Material USCF, the Funds and each series of the Trusts produce limited promotional material, which includes websites and a fact-sheet for each of the Funds and each series of the Trusts.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P98_S1	All promotional material developed by USCF, the Funds and each series of the Trusts, including material posted on a website or printed on a fact-sheet, is reviewed for accuracy and approved prior to its public release by USCF s counsel to ensure its compliance with the relevant requirements of the SEC, the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, the National Futures Association ( NFA ) and the Commodity Futures Trading Commission ( CFTC ), and any other applicable regulatory authority.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P99_S0	In addition to procedures intended to safeguard against a Fund fact-sheet being misleading or deceptive, it is a USCF policy that Fund fact-sheets may only be distributed to the public when accompanied by the current applicable Fund prospectus.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P100_S0	As noted above, all content to be included on a Fund website is reviewed and approved by USCF s counsel prior to publication of such content on such website.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P100_S1	A review of website information is performed each time new information placed on the website would lead to a substantively new version of the web page.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P100_S2	The review and approval of website material is documented by the supervisor in charge of such review.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P101_S0	USCF does not allow the use of personal websites by its employees or agents for the solicitation of business to any of the Funds.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P102_S0	USCF, or its service providers, maintains the supporting documentation for all statements, claims and performance results referenced in promotional material prepared by or on behalf of the Funds.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P103_S0	Intellectual Property Information Information generated in our business is a valuable asset.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P103_S1	Protecting this information plays an important role in our growth and ability to compete.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P103_S2	Such information includes business and research plans; objectives and strategies; trade secrets; unpublished financial information; salary and benefits data; and business partner lists.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P103_S3	Employees who have access to our intellectual property information are obligated to safeguard it from unauthorized access and must:
1396878_12_ITEM14_P104_S0	Not share this information with other employees except on a legitimate need to know basis.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P105_S0	Internet and E-mail Policy We may provide an e-mail system and Internet access to certain of our employees to help them do their work.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P105_S1	You may use the e-mail system and the Internet only for legitimate business purposes in the course of your duties.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P105_S2	Incidental and occasional personal use is permitted, but never for personal gain or any improper use.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P105_S3	Further, you are prohibited from discussing or posting information regarding the Company, the Trust or any of the Funds in any external electronic forum, including Internet chat rooms or electronic bulletin boards.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P105_S4	All employees engaged in the transmission of futures-related e-mails will be monitored periodically to ensure the accuracy of the information contained in such emails.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P105_S5	Review of such emails is performed by ALPS, as principal to registered representatives on an annual basis.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P105_S6	Review may also be undertaken by the Chief Compliance Officer and Counsel.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P105_S7	This type of review is performed in conformity with NFA and FINRA guidance on e-mail review, in consideration of the fact that USCF generally communicates with institutional or relatively sophisticated clients, while USCF s marketing agent handles most communication with the general public.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S0	Handling You are responsible for compliance with the rules, standards and principles described in this Code.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S1	In addition, you should be alert to possible violations of the Code by the Company s employees, officers and directors, and you are expected to report a violation promptly.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S2	Normally, reports should be made to one s immediate supervisor.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S3	Under some circumstances, it may be impractical or you may feel uncomfortable raising a matter with your supervisor.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S4	In those instances, you are encouraged to contact our Chief Compliance Officer who will investigate and report the matter to the Board of Directors, as the circumstance dictates.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S5	You will also be expected to cooperate in an investigation of a violation.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S6	Anyone who has a concern about our conduct, the conduct of an officer of the Company or our accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters, may communicate that concern to the Chief Compliance Officer or to the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors by direct communication with our Chairman of the Audit Committee or by e-mail or in writing.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S7	In addition, anyone who has a concern specifically about (i) the Trust or USCI may communicate that concern to the Chief Compliance Officer, or (ii) any of the Funds other than USCI, may communicate that concern to the Chief Compliance Officer or to the Audit Committee.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S8	All reported concerns shall be forwarded to the Chief Compliance Officer or the Audit Committee, as applicable, in the same way that other concerns are addressed by us.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S9	The status of all outstanding concerns forwarded to the Audit Committee or the Chief Compliance Officer will be reported on a quarterly basis by our Chairman of the Audit Committee or Chief Compliance Officer, as applicable.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S10	The Audit Committee or Chief Compliance Officer, as applicable, may direct that certain matters be presented to the full Board of Directors and may also direct special treatment, including the retention of outside advisors or counsel, for any concern reported to it.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S11	All reports will be investigated and whenever possible, requests for confidentiality shall be honored.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S12	And, while anonymous reports will be accepted, please understand that anonymity may hinder or impede the investigation of a report.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S13	All cases of questionable activity or improper actions will be reviewed for appropriate action, discipline or corrective actions.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S14	Whenever possible, we will keep confidential the identity of employees, officers or directors who are accused of violations, unless or until it has been determined that a violation has occurred.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P106_S15	There will be no reprisal, retaliation or adverse action taken against any employee who, in good faith, reports or assists in the investigation of, a violation or suspected violation, or who makes an inquiry about the appropriateness of an anticipated or actual course of action.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P107_S0	For reporting concerns about the conduct of the Company, the Trust or any Fund, the conduct of an officer of the Company, or about accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters of the Company, the Trust or any Fund, you may use the following means of communication: If to the Chief Compliance Officer:
1396878_12_ITEM14_P108_S0	If to the Chairman of the Audit Committee:
1396878_12_ITEM14_P109_S0	Unitholder Complaint Handling Complaints from unitholders of a Fund may raise compliance issues that need to be addressed in an expeditious manner.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P109_S1	All complaints received by any associated person of USCF or any Fund are to be forwarded to the Chief Compliance Officer.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P109_S2	Associated persons have been instructed to forward to the Chief Compliance Officer any oral questions that cannot be readily addressed so that such questions can be treated as complaints if the Chief Compliance Officer deems necessary.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P109_S3	It is the general policy of USCF and the Funds to answer all complaints.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P109_S4	A discussion of any complaints received will be an agenda item at each quarterly meeting of the Board of Directors of USCF.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P110_S0	The Chief Compliance Officer s duties with respect to unitholder complaints include: (1) maintaining a log that documents all complaints, (2) investigating complaints as needed, (3) making a recommendation for resolution of all complaints received, and (4) instituting any necessary changes to policies and procedures in connection with or in response to complaints.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P111_S0	USCF maintains records of all written complaints that are received by any party in connection with the Funds, as well as records relating to the resolution of such complaints.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P111_S1	In light of the responsibilities placed on USCF s marketing agent, it is likely that the marketing agent will also receive complaints from unitholders from time to time.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P111_S2	The marketing agent will address these complaints pursuant to its own procedures, but notice of such complaints will be forwarded to the Chief Compliance Officer to be documented in the complaint log.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P111_S3	The marketing agent will be responsible for addressing any complaints that it receives pursuant to the marketing agent s own procedures and will forward notice of material complaints to the Chief Compliance Officer.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P112_S0	Six (6) years, the first two (2) years in an easily accessible place Sanctions for Code Violations All violations of the Code will result in appropriate corrective action, up to and including dismissal.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P112_S1	If the violation involves potentially criminal activity, the individual or individuals in question will be reported, as warranted, to the appropriate authorities.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P112_S2	All of the officers, directors, and employees are subject to this Code.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P112_S3	Any waiver of this Code for an executive officer or director of the Company may only be made by the Board of Directors or the Audit Committee.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P112_S4	Any waiver of the Code for an officer or member of our Boards of Directors must be promptly disclosed to unitholders.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P113_S0	The Chief Compliance Officer of USCF is responsible for overseeing our ethics training program.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P113_S1	The Chief Compliance Officer of USCF conducts an annual review of USCF s ethics training policy and will require ethics training on an as needed basis.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P114_S0	This acknowledgment is to be signed and returned to our Chief Compliance Officer, Howard Mah, and will be retained as part of your permanent personnel file.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P115_S0	LLC s Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, read it, and understand that the Code contains the expectations of United States Commodity Funds LLC regarding employee conduct.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P115_S1	I also understand that the Code is issued for informational purposes and that it is not intended to create, nor does it represent, a contract of employment.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P116_S0	LLC s Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.

1396878_12_ITEM14_P119_S2	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report; 4.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P119_S3	The registrant s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have: (a) Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared; (b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles; (c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and (d) Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant s internal control over financial reporting; and 5.
1396878_12_ITEM14_P119_S4	The registrant s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant s Board of Directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions): (a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and (b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant s internal control over financial reporting.
